name: Courtyard San Francisco Airport/Oyster Point Waterfront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here two nights mainly because of price and convenience. The location isn't that great considering it's right next to the train track and freeway and there's nothing nearby except other hotels and business. It served the purpose of having a place to stay while we were visiting San Francisco and before moving on to Sonoma.
reviews.title: Nice Stay - Nice Service

reviews.text: Getting from the airport is slow - you have to walk outside the airport and wait for the shuttle which took over half an hour. The shuttle serves other hotels as well so ours was the last to drop off. Check in was fast and easy and the room was small but nice.
reviews.title: Convenient To Airport For Early Out Flights

reviews.text: Breakfast is available in a bistro-style setting. The good thing is Starbucks coffee and pastries but the bad thing is very limited menu.
reviews.title: OK, but won't go back

reviews.text: Nice all around experience and probably would stay again.
reviews.title: even better, new refurbishment

reviews.text: I typically use this Marriot CY location when I have a 6:00 am flight out the following morning. Although the Oyster Point location is not in walking distance of restaurants or any retail establishements, it is close to the airport. A 5 minute drive to San Bruno Avenue for car return or take the hotel shuttle. There is a couple gas stations nearby for filling up the car.
reviews.title: nice hotel but poor management

reviews.text: I have stayed here multiple times in the past. As a Platinum Elite member I did ask for a 1st floor room this time because I was traveling with a lot of luggage. The room was tired. The closet doors were broken and unable to be opened. I do not believe this hotel has been updated to reflect the new brand. It is comfortable for a 1 night airport stay but I would not use it for anything else. The prior visit, my room smelled like a chimney. Service was middle of the road too.
reviews.title: Hotel is getting tired

reviews.text: Overall very impressed! Waterfront property but no "big deal" just a nice ambiance. Rooms were well appointed, clean and bug-free (a plus in Bay area). Beds were comfy. Well situated for San Fran via 101, very close to Genentech/baybiobiz - easy to get to Airport (good Shuttle service) - easy access to freeway. BART runs alongside....try to get rooms on bayside of the property.
reviews.title: Sittin' On the Dock of the Bay...........

reviews.text: Pool/Gym were clean if not spacious and the front desk staff helpful and generally unflappable.
reviews.title: Useful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking easy, and no charge. Wired internet worked great, the wireless was poor....the restaurant was definitely so-so and snacks and beverages at front desk embarrassingly overpriced.
reviews.title: Good Reviews on this Courtyard - Impossible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short - it's a COURTYARD - as examples of the brand go, this qualifies as one of the better examples lately! My ultimate recommendation - I hope to stay there again on my next trip to S.San Fran! If they can earn my repeat business, chances are they'll earn yours too.
reviews.title: ONGOING NIGHTMARE

reviews.text: I arrived the hotel on business. It was late at night. The night staff was welcoming. I was disappointed to see it was under construction right in the middle where the main lobby will be. More so because you have to walk from one side of the hotel to the other when you need things. It's pretty much split in two. The jacuzzi is also not working. On another note, the staff was quite friendly, the shuttle driver was great and always on time but it does stop at various hotels. The restaurant food was great and the waitress - Flavia was exceptional and quite helpful. The rooms were clean. However, it is in a business district so if you want to go anywhere - food, entertainment, etc.. get a rental car...
reviews.title: Good service. Under Construction. In Business Area - Make sure to get a Rental Car.
Night Manager Has "0" Customer Service Skills
reviews.text: Arrived from Asia and had already moved from a previous area Marriott as the business center was down (See review of Courtyard Foster City). I called in advance to the Oyster Point location to ensure the business center was available and was told it was. Arrived and the printer that I need to perform my work was out of toner with no replacement cartridge. General Manager was great and offered to let me use the Marriott front desk computer and personally went to a local office supply and bought another toner cartridge for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problems began in the evening when I attempted to print a single page so that I could finish my work and put my jet lagged self to bed. Went down to the single business center computer and there was a women bidding on E Bay and she wouldn't budge. Night staff told me guests were supposed to only be online only for 30 minutes at at time but that she had been there at least 3 hours. I spoke to the night manager (young guy on a power trip) and asked if I could use the front desk internet access and printer as I had before. Was told "NO it's against company policy" (Note to night manager, it is also against company policy to allow a single guest to monopolize the only business center computer and printer for greater than 3 hours). By this time the front desk personnel knew what I had been through and allowed me to use their computer and print-out my single page. I am always amazed how anti-social people (i.e., the night manager) think that they can work in the hotel and service industry.
reviews.title: Near the Airport, Comfortable - But Undergoing Renovation

reviews.text: Courtyards are comfortable. The room and beds were great, however the website doesn't ,mention it's being remodelled over a couple of months. The work should be done by May 1st. Since the lobby is out of action the shuttle drops you by a side door, Room converted into check in area, computer in a side acove as a business center. The hotel is convenient to the airport yet in the middle of a business park. Fortunately the hotel was operating a restaurant in a conference room during the construction. The food was remarkably good given the construction going on. The hotel shares a shuttle with other neaby hotels so you wait curbside at the airport until it cycles back. This isn't a problem once you know what to expect.
reviews.title: Close to Airport, but Nothin Else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The morning shuttle was right on time (4:53 AM). Coffee was ready for us early travellers. Just be aware there's construction going on and the normal Courtyard operation is disrupted.
reviews.title: Clean,comfortable and quiet

reviews.text: We stayed here just last week. Very friendly staff, helpful when we asked questions about the area, shuttle information etc. . The hotel has a lovely view in the back of the water , with a walking trail, the front overlooks what looked like a storage unit business, but you do see the mountains, too The lobby appeared to have recently been updated and was clean and modern . This hotel does not include a complimentary breakfast with your stay , but there is food available to buy.. The hotel is in the area of the airport, but the noise from the planes did not seem to be a distraction . I only heard one plane flying overhead. The room we had was very clean and appropriate space for two. . One awesome thing - a free shuttle pick up from the hotel about 9:45 am and drop off at the Hard Rock Cafe/Aquarium of the Bay for a visit to Fisherman's Wharf and all the activities available there. Do take advantage of that service! Overall , this is a nice hotel and I would stay here if traveling to San Francisco again
reviews.title: Very nice staff

reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel for two weeks while working in the area. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. Recent updates to the hotel give it a very modern feel in the lobby and restaurant area. The rooms are decent size with a small couch, coffee table and desk. Flat screen TVs with some good channels and large bathrooms are also found. A small fridge and microwave can be requested and delivered to the room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, But not much around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a beautiful location right on the water. There is a great walking/running trail just outside the hotel that runs along the water. Unfortunately, if you don't have a car, there is very little options for food and entertainment. The hotel restaurant is nice and has good food but is very overpriced. There is a great Deli about a mile down the road called Mike and Ken's Deli. Great food and good prices. The Hotel shuttle should be able to take you.
reviews.title: The exterior was much nicer than the room

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff

reviews.text: - Fantastic Customer Service
reviews.title: About what you would expect for an overpriced room in San Francisco

aka: Courtyard San Francisco Airport/Oyster Point Waterfront Hotel
